reviewText: Viva La Bam is constantly and unfairly being compared to Jackass. They are similar, but in very small ways, and the one that stands out the most is the fact that Bam Margera is in this as well. They don't do the same masochistic stunts you'd find in Jackass. There's rarely ever any forced vomiting or cruelty to animals (like in Wild Boys). What Bam does is torment his surprisingly tolerant parents. This, the first volume, contains the first eight episodes of the show (an entire season) plus a disc of special features:Episode 1: Phil's Hell Day/Bam's Skate Park: they couldn't have picked a better episode to start the season.Episode 2: Don't Feed Phil: Bam does everything in his power to deny Phil food for a day.Episode 3: Family Reunion: Bam's attention turns to his extended family, and you begin to realize that Bam isn't as crazy as his family.Episode 4: Viva Las Vegas: Rabb gets a mail order bride, and April and Phil celebrate their anniversary. Vito snaps.Episode 5: Paint Phil Blue & Other Stories: Bam paints Phil, steals April's car, and dig a tunnel into Vito's house.Episode 6: Very Merry Margera Christmas: Bam celebrates Christmas with friends in the only way he knows how.Episode 7: April's Revenge: Bam's gets what's coming to him yet April, the person responsible, doesn't realize what she's got herself into.Episode 8: Scavenger Hunt: Bam and friends tore all of West Chester in order to score points in a crazy scavenger hunt.The bonus in this collection, though, comes in the special features disc. This includes a heap of deleted scenes which are funnier than anything you can find in the series, if a little more gross at times. It has other things as well, but the deleted scenes are where to be when you pop this into your DVD player.Though still headed by a bunch of jerks, Viva La Bam isn't nearly as controversial as Jackass or even the CKY Trilogy, though it's equally as funny as both. These DVDs contain some simple laughs that are, at the very least, guaranteed, something that's needed in our world today. Pick this up if you liked Jackass or Wildboys, or are a fan of skateboarding.

reviewText: No matter how bad your parents thought you were as a kid, they should thank their lucky stars that they aren't Phil and April Margera. Professional skateboarder and all-around pain in the ass, Bam Margera is the Dennis the Menace for the new millennium. After the Jackass show ended it splintered off into two strains, one of which, Viva La Bam, stars Bam and his crew (other Jackass survivors, Ryan Dunn, Raab Himself, Rake Yorn, Brandon DiCamillo) as they find new ways to torment his long-suffering parents. Bam and his gang pull all sorts of pranks and stunts to make his parents' lives a living hell. Throw in the nearly incomprehensible Don Vito (Phil's rather large brother) and you've got the makings for one of the more entertaining reality shows.Fans will be pleased to know that all the episodes are featured gloriously uncut with all the cuss words intact! Breathe easy, parents. The uncut nastiness is limited to the language. The shameless nudity is still blurred.There are audio commentaries for every episode by Bam, Phil, April, Ryan, Brandon, Rake, Tim and Raab. As you can imagine, these are pretty funny, chaotic tracks as Bam and co. dish on all sorts of behind-the-scenes stories. Bam, obviously, dominates these tracks, but his mom does comment quite a bit as well. Although, the glaring omission of Don Vito is unacceptable!There are nine deleted scenes, including more footage of Bam building a skate park in his parent's house and Raab under the thrall of a hypnotist while the boys were in Las Vegas."Scavenger Hunt List" is the entire list of tasks that had to be accomplished from the season's climatic final episode."Q&A;**Holes" is a bunch of text screens with the cast answering several questions not so seriously.There is a small collection of behind-the-scenes photos.There is also music video's for Bam's brother's band, CKY, Clutch, Turbonegro and the DiCamillo Sisters (basically Brandon, Bam and the lead singer from the Bloodhound Gang).For such a nonsensical show there is a surprisingly amount of extras that are all done in the same flavour as the show. Even the menus capture the vibe of the show, which is a nice touch. Fans will no doubt dig this collection while all others are advised to stay far away! You may not derive any deep meaning from this show but there are worse ways to kill a Friday night.
summary: You think your parents had it rough?

reviewText: Watching Bam pick on his parents for eight episodes gets a little old, but there is a lot of funny stuff going on. A lot of the stunts are obviously staged and more planned out than Bam would lead his audience to believe, and that detracts, a bit, from the comedy of it all.The DVD is packed with a bunch of new footage including Raab getting hypnotized, which is moderately funny.

reviewText: Do I hate this show?  No.  Do I like this show?  I am not sure anymore.  This show got a little old after owning seasons one, two and three.  When I was told that it wasn't a good idea to buy this on DVD it turns out this show stood on the shelf for a while.  Bam should be more concerned about his family than himself.  He probably only destroyed his parents' house to make money and entertain us with this show.  I saw season five on TV and I wasn't entertained as much as the other seasons did.  When Johnny Knoxville showed up I thought it was hilarious.  Bam got popular being a pro skater and also got fame with Jackass a show that rocks more than Viva La Bam.  He can do whatever the **** he wants just to get more money.  I can't wait to see the next upcoming Jackass movie.  Viva La Bam makes Jackass look bad.  Jackass isn't bad.  A show that can get old after a while.  Entertain yourself while it lasts.
summary: Average show that can get old after a while.  (The season one review.)

reviewText: First off, I am a child of the 90's. I came of age in the early 2000's, so I pretty much grew up watching the last of the good MTV shows (Classics like the original Osbournes, Jackass, TRL with Carson Daily, and of course, the epic, the wonderful, Viva La Bam. I don't even own this set yet but I'm working on it. In the meantime I go to my best friends house and watch her set of this amazing DVD collection. We spend hours laughing, rolling on the floor clutching our stomachs. In fact, the only reason I'm writing this review on MTV-VIva La Bam-The Complete First Season is because I wanted to highlight the gems that are Bam's Indoor/Outside Skatepark, Don't Feed Phil Day and my own personal favorite, The Three Day Weekend. The indoor skatepark is classic. The look on Ape's face when she and Phil walk through the door after returning from Atlantic City is worth the price of the set alone. And don't even get me started on the 3 Day Weekend. How much better can it get than not only painting Phil, but also stealing Ape's car, pimping the S*&$! out of it, and returning it to her at the end? But no, it gets better. I don't know how it can but it does. The tunnel under Don Vito's house while Dico and Dunn distract him is probably my favorite comedic scene in all of TV history. And the purpose is classic Bam. I dare you not to laugh when the ambush is at last pulled off. Wonderful. A nice little slice of my teenage years, all wrapped up in a pretty plastic package.If you are a true child of the 90's you should get this. It's seriously worth every penny.

reviewText: Well im glad its coming out but I wish it would have included season 2 also. Giving us season 1 is just going to make us want the other seasons more. This is an awesome show though. Don Vito is hilarious. Bam's cool. It's neat to see someone who can get away with anything they want to do. What you'll get in this set s 8 episodes(Listed below). It's 150 minutes long. A little bit of extras. What you'll see in these episodes is Phil starving because he can't eat anything for one day, Bam and his friends stuck on an island for a day, Don Vito getting kicked out of a casino, Don Vito racing another guy on a motorized cart, a lot of cars being totally smashed, an entire skatepark/ice rink built in and outside Bam's house, AND LOT'S MORE. That's just a little of season 1. The only thing I don't get is that Wildboyz Season 1 is 25 minutes longer then this season of Viva La Bam and this set is almost 10 dollars more. Still this is a good set to own.(Below episodes listed for Season 1)Phil's Hell DayBam Hosts A Concert (don't feed Phil)The Family ReunionWe're Going to Vegas!Three-Day WeekendThe Christmas EpisodeApril Gets RevengeThe Scavenger Hunt

reviewText: Remember the first CKY video? Remember when it was just Bam and his friends, making videos as kids, just for fun? The first three CKYs were made by the crew just for plain fun. They didn't seem to care about money. Then CKY4 came out, all in a glossy package and high quality production and such. Sure, it was great, it was hilarious, and one of my favorites, but it just seemed kind of forced. But this? "Viva La Bam"? Give me a f*cking break. I remember I actually thought Bam was cool. I wanted to be like Bam. I wore heartarams on everything (he's trying to ruin HIM!! I swear it!!!), I said "haggard" all the time, I used his stupid voice where it sounds like he's holding in a laugh all the time. I mean, LOOK AT THIS! It's so god damn forced! I'm sure the pay check makes it worth it to Bam, but to old school fans like me, we were satisfied with him just being himself-some bored, normal, every day teen, coming up in a pretty normal family, spending his days making pain-inducing videos with friends. I mean, you I could relate to that. Not the pain-inducing videos part, but the bored, normal kid part part. But this is just too much. I can understand how he might want a little money, but completely leaving behind CKY to go for this MTV s*it?? Jackass was great, but it wasn't all Bam, Bam, Bam. And look at the new Tony Hawk game!! Bam is almost THE main character! I would't be suprised if they released a Bam Margera's Pro Skater. It's just gotten out of control. I can proudly say that I have ripped all my heartagrams off and stopped all my Bam jargin, but I still also listen to HIM and CKY, but I don't go around saying they're my favorite bands. Nothing makes me sicker then seeing HIM t-shirts at Hot Topic, right next to Viva La Bam of Don't Feed Phil shirts. I remember when I found out about HIM and loved them, but now, it's basically if you like Bam, you have to like HIM. And what's up with these kids liking every band Bam likes? I mean, if you like a few, that's cool, but I seen Amazon lists titled "Best CDs Ever" or something like that, and what do I see on the list? HIM, CKY, Turbonegro (they suck), The 69 Eyes (they suck bad), Cradle of Filth, Dimmu Borgir, Bloodhound Gang (I don't like 'em, but they're pretty funny), Hardcore Superstar (they suck), and so on. Be yourself. If you want to watch Viva La Bam, cool, but don't f*cking imitate Bam like I used to. As for me, I get sick every time I watch Viva La Bam.Viva La Brandon DiCamillo-now THAT would be funny.

reviewText: In some families there is that one child that has seemingly made it their life's goal to drive their parents and neighbors completely nuts and raise more hell than humanly possible.  For Phil and April Margera, their hellraiser of a son is a little older than most problem children.Bam Margera is a former member of the crew from the hit MTV series Jackass.  During the series run and in the subsequent movie, Bam would do whatever he wanted to do that would possibly drive Phil, April, or both up the wall at their expense.  When the series ended in 2002 Bam decided that he wasn't done with his tomfoolery and got a deal with MTV to get his own series in which he would get to do, as he so often states, "whatever the f--- I want".  The end result would lead to the creation of his own series that would also create the network's hit "Sunday Stew" lineup of shows.Viva La Bam is the more higher-scaled version of what spawned from Bam's misadventures from Jackass.  In the series Bam finds a way to have as much fun as he wants while doing his best to raise havoc for Phil, April, his uncle Don Vito, and his crew of friends (Ryan Dunn, Rake Yohn, Raab Himself, and Brandon DiCamillo).VLB: The Complete First Season is the collection that introduces us to the entire Margera family (well not entirely: we don't learn until April says in one episode that she is "glad that we stopped at two children" and we don't meet the second child, Bam's brother Jess, until the first episode of Season 2).  The set contains two disc, the first containing the first 8 episodes of Viva La Bam, with the added advantage that each episode is uncensored which means that every one of the expletives that were bleeped when the episodes originally aired on MTV is clear as a bell.  Also included on the first disc is a running commentary through the episodes from the entire cast (with the glaring exception of Don Vito, which would have really been a blast to hear).The 2 classic episodes to watch are the series opener, Bam's Skate Park (in which Bam sends Phil and April to Atlantic City for 36 hours while Bam constructs a giant indoor/outdoor skate park in the house and invites several world famous skateboarders, including the legendary Tony Hawk), and Don't Feed Phil (where Bam decides to challenge Phil to a quest to not eat a single piece of food for an entire 24 hour day, while the entire crew (not to mention the entire STATE!) are tasked to make sure that it happens, but someone is going to try to put the kibosh on the whole thing by...CHEATING!!!)The second disc of the set is the additional stuff that any VLB fan would want with deleted scenes, including the extended director's cut versions of Bam's Skate Park (aka the series premiere) and Don't Feed Phil!  Also included are cast bios and exclusive music videos from CKY, Clutch and Turbonegro, random moments that weren't included in the deleted scenes, and more.All in all, there is more for the average Bam fan than should legally be allowed.  So if Bam wants to do whatever he wants, then let us revel in the fun along with him and shout, "Viva La Bam!"
summary: Just be glad this isn't YOUR kid...
Title: N/A
